page.title: 15AQUATIC LIFE.
page.content: Although the spring had been one of the wettest on record, most of the ponds and streams were virtually dried up. (perhaps as a result of the exceptionally hot summer last year.) Examination of water from the few pools remaining revealed little in the way of wildlife. This may have been due to farming practices, (fertilizer application etc.), or perhaps the ingress of sea water from local drains. (The area is very low lying and it is not unusual to find freshwater streams and saline drains within 200m of each other.) That local conditions in general are capable of supporting varied aquatic communities is proved by the fact that a private pond surveyed contained a variety of tadpoles, newts, frogs etc. Surprisingly, insect nymphs were scarce.
